pageContext.description: Edge badly notched, point turned. Hilt somewhat damaged.
pageContext.patina: Traces of patina brown, worn off in most places. Metal showing faintly in places.
pageContext.site: England,Cornwall,St. Keverne,Carnpessade (about 500 ft SE of Carnpessach Farm),near Cattle drinking-trough,July 1923
pageContext.toSearch: St Keverne, Helston, Cornwall Tr12, UK
pageContext.remarks: The sword was found by the tenant, Mr. W. J. Carlyon, in boggy ground near the drinking trough, fully buried with the exception of the point, which attracted the finder's attention: it was lying diagonally in the bog.
